definitions.definition: speech or writing that is intended to influence people, but that is not completely honest or sincere

examples.text: Her speech was just empty rhetoric.
His speech was dismissed as mere rhetoric by the opposition.
Behind all the rhetoric, his relations with the army are tense.
He was prepared to use militant rhetoric in attacking his opponents.
Little has changed, despite the rhetoric about reform.
official rhetoric on the virtues of large families

definitions.definition: the art of using language in speech or writing in a special way that influences or entertains people

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French rethorique, via Latin from Greek rhētorikē (tekhnē) ‘(art) of rhetoric’, from rhētōr ‘rhetor’.
